intro: Dunalia aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange-flowered dunalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes beans and peas. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange flowers, which bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Dunalia aurantiaca is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
